poem:
Title: "In Suit of Justice"

With London's fragments, Manchester's tears,
under the weight of memory's years.
A gavel echoes in silent halls,
while Justice, barefoot, softly calls.

No cloaked body named to blame,
but a singular, familiar frame.
Affix the pain to his private name,
the fire's birth, the bomb's claim.

To sue the shadow, the looming dread,
seeking solace, and hush the dead.
